trans-unit.source: How to use SQL Database (.NET) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use SQL Database (.NET) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get started with SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Get started with SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a SQL Database instance and connect to it using ADO.NET, ODBC, and EntityClient Provider.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a SQL Database instance and connect to it using ADO.NET, ODBC, and EntityClient Provider.

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure SQL Database in .NET applications
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure SQL Database in .NET applications

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to create a logical server and database instance on Azure SQL Database and connect to
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to create a logical server and database instance on Azure SQL Database and connect to

trans-unit.source: the database using the following .NET Framework data provider technologies:
trans-unit.target: the database using the following .NET Framework data provider technologies:

trans-unit.source: ADO.NET, ODBC, and EntityClient Provider.
trans-unit.target: ADO.NET, ODBC, and EntityClient Provider.

trans-unit.source: What is SQL Database
trans-unit.target: What is SQL Database

trans-unit.source: SQL Database provides a relational database management system for Azure and is based on SQL Server technology.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database provides a relational database management system for Azure and is based on SQL Server technology.

trans-unit.source: With a SQL Database instance, you can easily provision and deploy relational database solutions to the cloud, and take advantage of a distributed data center that provides enterprise-class availability, scalability, and security with the benefits of built-in data protection and self-healing.
trans-unit.target: With a SQL Database instance, you can easily provision and deploy relational database solutions to the cloud, and take advantage of a distributed data center that provides enterprise-class availability, scalability, and security with the benefits of built-in data protection and self-healing.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to Azure
trans-unit.target: Sign in to Azure

trans-unit.source: SQL Database provides relational data storage, access, and management services on Azure.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database provides relational data storage, access, and management services on Azure.

trans-unit.source: To use it, you'll need an Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: To use it, you'll need an Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Open a web browser, and browse to [http://azure.microsoft.com/](http://azure.microsoft.com).
trans-unit.target: Open a web browser, and browse to [http://azure.microsoft.com/](http://azure.microsoft.com).

trans-unit.source: To get started with a free account, click free trial in the upper right corner and follow the steps.
trans-unit.target: To get started with a free account, click free trial in the upper right corner and follow the steps.

trans-unit.source: Your account is now created.
trans-unit.target: Your account is now created.

trans-unit.source: You are ready to get started.
trans-unit.target: You are ready to get started.

trans-unit.source: Create and configure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Create and configure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Next, create and configure a database and server.
trans-unit.target: Next, create and configure a database and server.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, revised workflows let you create the database first, and follow up with server provisioning.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, revised workflows let you create the database first, and follow up with server provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Create a database instance and logical server:
trans-unit.target: Create a database instance and logical server:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Click **NEW** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **NEW** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click **Data Services**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Data Services**.

trans-unit.source: Click **SQL Database**.
trans-unit.target: Click **SQL Database**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Custom Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Custom Create**.

trans-unit.source: In Name, enter a database name.
trans-unit.target: In Name, enter a database name.

trans-unit.source: Choose an edition, maximum size, and collation.
trans-unit.target: Choose an edition, maximum size, and collation.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this guide, you can use the default values.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this guide, you can use the default values.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database provides three database editions, Basic, Standard and Premium.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database provides three database editions, Basic, Standard and Premium.

trans-unit.source: The MAXSIZE is specified when the database is first created and can
trans-unit.target: The MAXSIZE is specified when the database is first created and can

trans-unit.source: later be changed using ALTER DATABASE.
trans-unit.target: later be changed using ALTER DATABASE.

trans-unit.source: MAXSIZE provides the ability to
trans-unit.target: MAXSIZE provides the ability to

trans-unit.source: limit the size of the database.
trans-unit.target: limit the size of the database.

trans-unit.source: For each SQL database created on Azure, there are actually three
trans-unit.target: For each SQL database created on Azure, there are actually three

trans-unit.source: replicas of that database.
trans-unit.target: replicas of that database.

trans-unit.source: This is done to ensure high availability.
trans-unit.target: This is done to ensure high availability.

trans-unit.source: Failover is transparent and part of the service.
trans-unit.target: Failover is transparent and part of the service.

trans-unit.source: In Server, select **New SQL Database Server**.
trans-unit.target: In Server, select **New SQL Database Server**.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow to go on to the next page.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow to go on to the next page.

trans-unit.source: In Server Settings, enter a SQL Server authentication login name.
trans-unit.target: In Server Settings, enter a SQL Server authentication login name.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database uses SQL Authentication over an encrypted connection.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database uses SQL Authentication over an encrypted connection.

trans-unit.source: A new SQL Server authentication login assigned to the sysadmin fixed server role will be created using the name you provide.
trans-unit.target: A new SQL Server authentication login assigned to the sysadmin fixed server role will be created using the name you provide.

trans-unit.source: The login cannot be an email address, Windows user account, or a Windows Live ID.
trans-unit.target: The login cannot be an email address, Windows user account, or a Windows Live ID.

trans-unit.source: Neither Claims nor Windows authentication is supported on SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Neither Claims nor Windows authentication is supported on SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Provide a strong password that is over eight characters, using a combination of upper and lower case values, and a number or symbol.
trans-unit.target: Provide a strong password that is over eight characters, using a combination of upper and lower case values, and a number or symbol.

trans-unit.source: Choose a region.
trans-unit.target: Choose a region.

trans-unit.source: Region determines the geographical location of the server.
trans-unit.target: Region determines the geographical location of the server.

trans-unit.source: Regions cannot be easily switched, so choose one that makes sense for this server.
trans-unit.target: Regions cannot be easily switched, so choose one that makes sense for this server.

trans-unit.source: Choose a location that is closest to you.
trans-unit.target: Choose a location that is closest to you.

trans-unit.source: Keeping your Azure application and database in the same region saves you on egress bandwidth cost and data latency.
trans-unit.target: Keeping your Azure application and database in the same region saves you on egress bandwidth cost and data latency.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to keep the **Allow Azure Services to access the server** option selected so that you can connect to this database using the Management Portal for SQL Database, storage services, and other services on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to keep the **Allow Azure Services to access the server** option selected so that you can connect to this database using the Management Portal for SQL Database, storage services, and other services on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark at the bottom of the page when you are finished.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark at the bottom of the page when you are finished.

trans-unit.source: Notice that you did not specify a server name.
trans-unit.target: Notice that you did not specify a server name.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database auto-generates the server name to ensure there are no duplicate DNS entries.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database auto-generates the server name to ensure there are no duplicate DNS entries.

trans-unit.source: The server name is a ten-character alphanumeric string.
trans-unit.target: The server name is a ten-character alphanumeric string.

trans-unit.source: You cannot change the name of your SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: You cannot change the name of your SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: After the database is created, click on it to open its dashboard.
trans-unit.target: After the database is created, click on it to open its dashboard.

trans-unit.source: The dashboard provides connection strings that you can copy and use in application code.
trans-unit.target: The dashboard provides connection strings that you can copy and use in application code.

trans-unit.source: It also shows the management URL that you'll need to specify if you are connecting to the database from Management Studio or other administrative tool.
trans-unit.target: It also shows the management URL that you'll need to specify if you are connecting to the database from Management Studio or other administrative tool.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Database dashboard
trans-unit.target: The SQL Database dashboard

trans-unit.source: In the next step, you will configure the firewall so that connections from applications running on your network are allowed access.
trans-unit.target: In the next step, you will configure the firewall so that connections from applications running on your network are allowed access.

trans-unit.source: Configure the firewall for the logical server
trans-unit.target: Configure the firewall for the logical server

trans-unit.source: Click **SQL Databases**, click **Servers** at the top of the page, and then click on the server you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click **SQL Databases**, click **Servers** at the top of the page, and then click on the server you just created.

trans-unit.source: Setting up a firewall
trans-unit.target: Setting up a firewall

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: Copy the current client IP address.
trans-unit.target: Copy the current client IP address.

trans-unit.source: If you are connecting from a network, this is the IP address that your router or proxy server is listening on.
trans-unit.target: If you are connecting from a network, this is the IP address that your router or proxy server is listening on.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database detects the IP address used by the current connection so that you can create a firewall rule to accept connection requests from this device.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database detects the IP address used by the current connection so that you can create a firewall rule to accept connection requests from this device.

trans-unit.source: Paste the IP address into both the START IP ADDRESS and END IP ADDRESS to establish the range addresses that are allowed to access the server.
trans-unit.target: Paste the IP address into both the START IP ADDRESS and END IP ADDRESS to establish the range addresses that are allowed to access the server.

trans-unit.source: Later, if you encounter connection errors indicating that the range is too narrow, you can edit this rule to widen the range.
trans-unit.target: Later, if you encounter connection errors indicating that the range is too narrow, you can edit this rule to widen the range.

trans-unit.source: If client computers use dynamically assigned IP addresses, you must specify a range that is broad enough to include IP addresses assigned to computers in your network.
trans-unit.target: If client computers use dynamically assigned IP addresses, you must specify a range that is broad enough to include IP addresses assigned to computers in your network.

trans-unit.source: Start with a narrow range, and then expand it only if you need to.
trans-unit.target: Start with a narrow range, and then expand it only if you need to.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the firewall rule, such as the name of your computer or company.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the firewall rule, such as the name of your computer or company.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark next to the rule to save it.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark next to the rule to save it.

trans-unit.source: IP range for firewall settings
trans-unit.target: IP range for firewall settings

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** at the bottom of the page to complete the step.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** at the bottom of the page to complete the step.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see **Save**, refresh the browser page.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see **Save**, refresh the browser page.

trans-unit.source: You now have a database instance, logical server, a firewall rule that allows inbound connections from your IP address, and an administrator login.
trans-unit.target: You now have a database instance, logical server, a firewall rule that allows inbound connections from your IP address, and an administrator login.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to connect to the database programmatically.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to connect to the database programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to connect to SQL Database instance using different
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to connect to SQL Database instance using different

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework data providers.
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework data providers.

trans-unit.target: For central recommendations about connecting to an SQL Database server and database, see:

trans-unit.source: [Connections to SQL Database: Central recommendations](../sql-database-connect-central-recommendations.md).
trans-unit.target: [Connections to SQL Database: Central recommendations](../sql-database-connect-central-recommendations.md).

trans-unit.target: If you choose to use Visual Studio and your configuration doesn't

trans-unit.source: include an Azure web application as a front-end, there are no
trans-unit.target: include an Azure web application as a front-end, there are no

trans-unit.source: additional tools or SDKs needed to be installed on the development
trans-unit.target: additional tools or SDKs needed to be installed on the development

trans-unit.source: computer.
trans-unit.target: computer.

trans-unit.source: You can just start developing your application.
trans-unit.target: You can just start developing your application.

trans-unit.source: You can use all of the same designer tools in Visual Studio to work with
trans-unit.target: You can use all of the same designer tools in Visual Studio to work with

trans-unit.source: SQL Database as you can to work with SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database as you can to work with SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: The Server Explorer allows
trans-unit.target: The Server Explorer allows

trans-unit.source: you to view (but not edit) database objects.
trans-unit.target: you to view (but not edit) database objects.

trans-unit.source: The Visual Studio Entity
trans-unit.target: The Visual Studio Entity

trans-unit.source: Data Model Designer is fully functional and you can use it to create
trans-unit.target: Data Model Designer is fully functional and you can use it to create

trans-unit.source: models against SQL Database for working with Entity Framework.
trans-unit.target: models against SQL Database for working with Entity Framework.

trans-unit.source: Using EntityClient Provider
trans-unit.target: Using EntityClient Provider

trans-unit.source: The **System.Data.EntityClient** namespace is the .NET Framework Data
trans-unit.target: The **System.Data.EntityClient** namespace is the .NET Framework Data

trans-unit.source: Provider for the Entity Framework.
trans-unit.target: Provider for the Entity Framework.

trans-unit.source: The Entity Framework enables developers to create data access
trans-unit.target: The Entity Framework enables developers to create data access

trans-unit.source: applications by programming against a conceptual application model
trans-unit.target: applications by programming against a conceptual application model

trans-unit.source: instead of programming directly against a relational storage schema.
trans-unit.target: instead of programming directly against a relational storage schema.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: Entity Framework builds on top of storage-specific ADO.NET data
trans-unit.target: Entity Framework builds on top of storage-specific ADO.NET data

trans-unit.source: providers by providing an **EntityConnection** to an underlying data
trans-unit.target: providers by providing an **EntityConnection** to an underlying data

trans-unit.source: provider and relational database.
trans-unit.target: provider and relational database.

trans-unit.source: To construct an **EntityConnection** object, you have to reference a set
trans-unit.target: To construct an **EntityConnection** object, you have to reference a set

trans-unit.source: of metadata that contains the necessary models and mapping, and also a
trans-unit.target: of metadata that contains the necessary models and mapping, and also a

trans-unit.source: storage-specific data provider name and connection string.
trans-unit.target: storage-specific data provider name and connection string.
